Available.description: Authorization caching is available, but not necessarily enabled.

Enabled.description: If set to true, Authorizaiton caching is enabled.

AuthCacheLifeTime.description: Indicates how long it takes until a token expires in the authorization cache since it is last used

AuthCachePolicy.description: Cache Entry Replacement Policy: least recently used, least frequently used, first in first out, other custom mechanism.

AuthCacheStorage.description: Indicates the number of bytes currently used by the Authorization Cache. MaxLimit indicates the maximum number of bytes that can be used by the Authorization Cache.

AuthCacheDisablePostAuthorize.description: When set to true this variable disables the behavior to request authorization for an idToken that is stored in the cache with a status other than Accepted, as stated in C10.FR.03 and C12.FR.05.
